The staff is phenomenal. They are knowledgable and capable.  There are two tasting menus.  The gastronomic menu was enjoyed by my husband and son. Skip the other menu completely.  Most ofThe courses were poorly executed and improperly seasoned.  The fist course that was common to both menus. None of us particularly enjoyed it. The pumpkin  texture was off and the taste to cheesy. The fried items accompanying this tasted like oil.   I can go into greater detail with each course such as the rare, cold improperly rendered duck or the salty inedible rice served with the sweetbread or the underseasoned white fish with the olives.  While one may feel that they are experiencing something unique the bottom line is flavor.  It just wasn't there. If ever you want to try a true experience eat at blue hill in New York. You will see that there is no comparison.
